title: The three worthy butchers of the north I weep, I wail, and travel much in pain, now all my youthful days are past, they'l never come again; once I was a man, but now alas I am none, for all my companions are from me fled and gone. To a pleasant new tune.
author: Burges, Paul.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, in West-smithfield,
notes: Verse - "Did you never hear of worthy butchers three,".
Place of publication from and date conjectured by Wing.
Identified on reel 2123 as Wing (2nd ed.) S574.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
